etymology.description: Simplified from 行 – the right side of the character.
etymology.interpretation: Essentially the right-hand component of 行 abstracted as an independent graph. Since 行 relates to walking, the extracted half came to convey the idea of a small step or the act of stepping.

examples.chinese: 他只亍了一小步(他只亍了一小步)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǐ chù le yī xiǎo bù.
examples.english: He only stepped a small step.

examples.chinese: 老师说先亍两步，再停下(老師說先亍兩步，再停下)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī shuō xiān chù liǎng bù, zài tíng xià.
examples.english: The teacher said to step two paces first, then stop.

examples.chinese: 在碑文里常见“亍”表示小步(在碑文裡常見「亍」表示小步)。
examples.pinyin: Zài bēiwén lǐ chángjiàn “chù” biǎoshì xiǎo bù.
examples.english: In inscriptions, “亍” is often seen to denote a small step.
